availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, shoe maker. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Marrs. Father of M. A. Marrs, Mary Marrs, Sarah Marrs, James Marrs, Harriet Marrs. Shoe maker in Taylor County in 1860. Owned one enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 664.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville , p. 232B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 2, p. 6.
